title: Robusta Coffee Set for Weekly Jump on Supply Woes in Top Growers
summary: Robusta coffee was on track for the biggest weekly gain in at least 17 years in London, as concerns over tight supplies from the two largest producers keep the market on edge.

title: Opendoor Hunts for CEO as Wheeler Steps Down, Lifting Shares
summary: Opendoor Technologies Inc., a real estate company that became a meme stock in recent months, said Chief Executive Officer Carrie Wheeler is stepping down immediately, an announcement that sent the stock surging.

title: Chips Act Fund Considered for Intel Stake
summary: The administration is willing to move quickly in order to bring more semiconductor manufacturing to the US as part of their AI strategy, reports Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Open Interest.”  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Stocks Decline as Consumer Sentiment Data Triggers Step Back
summary: US stocks stepped back from record highs as data showed consumer sentiment fell for the first time since April.

title: How Brazil’s Sugar Powerhouse Raízen Became a Penny Stock
summary: It was just another Tuesday morning in the heart of Brazil’s sugarcane region when workers in Sertãozinho, a small town four hours away from Sao Paulo, heard the news.

title: Chinese LNG Buyers Snap Up Imports as Prices Fall to Refill Storage
summary: China’s liquefied natural gas buyers are boosting imports as falling prices and the need to replenish inventories end months of sluggish deliveries.

title: Oil Market Awaits Crucial Trump-Putin Meet as Prices Drift Lower
summary: Oil drifted lower, trading near $66 a barrel, as investors awaited a face-to-face summit between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin later Friday, an encounter with the potential to reshape crude flows from one of the world’s largest producers.

title: Major Lukoil Refinery Halts Oil Intake After Ukraine Strike
summary: Lukoil PJSC’s major Volgograd refinery has halted oil intake following one of the latest in a series of Ukrainian drone strikes on Russian energy assets, said a person familiar with the matter, who asked not to be named discussing non-public information.

title: US Consumer Sentiment Falls as Inflation Expectations Climb
summary: US consumer sentiment unexpectedly fell for the first time since April and inflation expectations rose on lingering anxiety about the impact of tariffs.

title: Stocks Fall From Record After Consumer Sentiment: Markets Wrap
summary: Wall Street traders sent stocks down from all-time highs after a gauge of consumer sentiment unexpectedly fell and inflation expectations rose.

title: Algeria Nears Deals With Exxon and Chevron in Shale Gas Push
summary: Algeria is close to finalizing a deal with Exxon Mobil Corp. and Chevron Corp. to tap the North African nation’s vast gas reserves, including shale, for the first time, a senior official said.

title: US Industrial Output Eases as Factories Grapple With Weak Demand
summary: US industrial production declined in July, restrained by tepid output among manufacturers pinched by cooler demand and shifting trade policy.

Standard Chartered’s stock is slumping as a Republican lawmaker calls for a probe
summary: Standard Chartered shares slumped on Friday after a lawmaker close to the Trump administration requested that the Justice Department probe the bank over alleged sanctions violations.

title: ‘I’ve been kept in poverty by social-services benefit cliffs’: Do I take a $70K job at 74 and lose my Section 8 housing allowance?
summary: “After the age of 50, I really only had sporadic contract work and I had to sell my house.”

title: Dow hits fresh record high as Warren Buffett gives Wall Street a brief upward nudge Friday
summary: The Dow on Friday notched its first intraday record high of this year, riding a wave of market optimism and a timely push from the Oracle of Omaha.

title: Americans more worried about inflation and unemployment after new trade deals leave tariffs at highest level in decades
summary: Fresh worries about inflation soured Americans on the economy in early August, underscoring lingering anxiety about the highest U.S. tariffs in decades and a further rise in unemployment.

title: Why Applied Materials’ latest earnings have investors so spooked
summary: Analysts wonder if China’s recent “overspending” on chip equipment is coming to a halt — and if the company is losing market share to rivals.

title: Car buyers rev up U.S. retail sales in effort to beat tariff price hikes. Economy is still growing.
summary: Sales at retailers rose solidly in July for the second month in a row, but the increase in spending appeared to be a double-edged sword: Americans are still confident enough in the economy to spend, but they are also paying more because of higher inflation.

title: Goldman researchers warn of an unfriendly asymmetry: Why the next big market move may be down.
summary: After 18 record highs, Goldman researchers say it’s time to prepare for a fall in the stock market.

title: Energy traders have already baked Alaska into the price, says BofA strategist. What could come next.
summary: Strategist notes S&P 500 price-to-book at record high, that Fed rate cuts threaten the dollar, and that energy bear market could get worse.

title: My wife and I are in our 50s and have $11 million. We’re not leaving it to our kids. Is that wrong?
summary: “We have retired from full-time work.”
